content:
Congratulations on redeeming your miles for a free flight to Las Vegas! That's a great use of your rewards.

Flexibility is key when searching for good deals on flights. Being open to different travel dates and times can help you find cheaper flights or better redemption rates.

Since you're flexible, I recommend setting up price alerts for flights to Nassau (NAS) or Freeport (FPO) on Google Flights, Skyscanner, or Airfarewatchdog. These websites can notify you when prices drop or when error fares become available.

Additionally, you can use American Airlines' fare sale alerts to receive notifications when they offer discounted fares to the Bahamas.

As an AAdvantage member, you can also take advantage of American Airlines' "Price Calendar" feature, which shows you the cheapest days to fly within a specific time period. This can help you identify the best dates for your trip.

When you find a good deal, be sure to compare the price with the number of miles required for an award ticket. If the cash price is low enough, it might be worth booking a paid ticket instead of redeeming your miles.

Remember to also consider other costs like accommodations, food, and activities when planning your trip to the Bahamas.

How's your experience been with Southwest Airlines so far? Have you flown with them before, or is this your first time?
